page.title: 14POLITICS
page.content: THE NORTH EAST ENVIRONS OF NEW RADNOR IS PART OF THE BRECON AND RADNOR PARLIAMENTARY CONSTITUENCY IN WHICH A BYE-ELECTION RECENTLY TOOK PLACE. THE MAIN PARTIES STANDING FOR ELECTION ON 4 JULY 1985 WERE - CHRIS BUTLER - CONSERVATIVE RICHARD WILLEY - LABOUR RICHARD LIVESEY - LIBERAL WHO GAINED THE MAJORITY VOTE AND WAS DULY ELECTED MP. CONTRARY TO NORMAL PRACTICE POLITICS WERE INTRODUCED INTO LOCAL COUNTY COUNCIL ELECTIONS THIS SUMMER WHEN THE CONSERVATIVE DEFEATED THE LABOUR CANDIDATE. THE AREA IS ALSO REPRESENTED ON THE DISTRICT COUNCIL BY A LOCAL COUNCILLOR.AN ELECTION IS ALSO HELD EVERY FOUR YEARS FOR CANDIDATES TO THE NON-POLITICAL COMMUNITY COUNCIL DEALING WITH LOCAL PROBLEMS.
